input_text:
Job Title: Manufacturing Process Engineer

Location: Richardson, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology, Manufacturing

Description:
Manufacturing Process Engineer Celestica Inc, headquartered in Toronto, Canada, is a multi-national design, manufacturing, hardware platform, & supply chain electronics manufacturing services company and operates across 50 sites in 15 countries. Celestica is seeking top-notch Manufacturing Process Engineering talent at its Richardson, TX location to be a part of a growing organization utilizing the latest and greatest Advanced Optics and AR/VR Technologies! Let’s Grow Together!
Job SummaryThe Manufacturing Process Engineer will be responsible for developing, deploying, and optimizing processes for manufacturing to achieve quality cost and delivery goals for Celestica and its customer’s products and will be working closely with the Test, Failure Analysis, Quality, and the Safety team.
Job Responsibilities  Develop and maintain manufacturing methods Create process routings and manufacturing instructions Design/build/procure tooling and fixturing as it relates to products Support equipment upgrades and conduct cost / benefit analysis for process changes Deliver improvement for process safety, quality, and cycle times Manage multiple projects simultaneously Utilize lean manufacturing principles to improve process capability, reduce overall costs and increase capacity Create manufacturing processes that are sustainable and repeatable while delivering a product that meets customer CTQ’s Participate in early-stage process development to ensure the successful capture of Manufacturing, Supply Chain, Quality, Test, Installation & Service requirements Propose different solutions outside of set parameters to address more complicated manufacturing processes with technical variety and/or interdependent production cycles Use technical experience and analytical thinking to acts as a resource and possibly lead small low-risk projects
Basic Qualifications  Bachelor's degree or higher in Mechanical Engineering or related discipline. Associates Degree OR High School Diploma plus 6 years of applicable work experience may be considered in lieu of a college degree 1+ years of experience as Manufacturing Engineer Ability to read engineering drawings. Strong oral and written communication skills. Experience with 3D modeling/CAD software Experience in print reading, wire schematic reading, and engineering specifications Experience with BOM (PLM) tools Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) tool(s). (i.e., Oracle, SAP) Strong data analysis skills. (i.e., Microsoft Excel tools, macros, etc.) Strong troubleshooting skills and problem solving Desired Qualifications Manufacturing process development experience in high-volume environment Six Sigma Certification (Yellow/Green/Black)
Physical Demands • Duties of this position are performed in a normal office environment• Duties may require extended periods of sitting and sustained visual concentration on a computer monitor or on numbers and other detailed data• Repetitive manual movements (e.g., data entry, using a computer mouse, etc.) are frequently required• Occasional travel may be required
NotesThis job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities of the position. Employees are held accountable for all duties of the job. Job duties and the % of time identified for any function are subject to change at any time.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
